summary: FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a BOP employee regarding observations of unusual document shredding at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The employee reported seeing large amounts of shredded paper being disposed of and hearing references to a BOP After Action team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the inmate whose suicide prompted a BOP After Action team investigation; the document shredding incident occurred in relation to this investigation.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Mentioned third-hand as having told the former MCC Warden that Epstein should be confined in the 10 South wing of MCC.

connections.description: The officer reportedly advised the former warden on Epstein's housing placement (10 South wing).

events.title: Document shredding incident at MCC
events.description: A BOP employee observed an inmate with large bags of shredded paper at the rear gate, mentioning that 'They are shredding everything back there' and referencing a white man with a Southern accent involved, possibly linked to the BOP After Action team for Epstein's suicide.

events.title: BOP employee reports to FBI
events.description: The interviewed BOP employee called the FBI to file a report about the document shredding incident.

events.title: FBI and DOJ-OIG interview
events.description: FBI and DOJ-OIG agents interviewed a BOP employee regarding the document shredding observations at MCC.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Epstein's suicide at MCC, which prompted a BOP After Action team investigation.

keyFacts: A BOP employee reported observing unusually large amounts of shredded paper being disposed of at MCC's rear gate around August 15, 2019, shortly after Epstein's suicide.
The employee heard the shredding was being done by or in connection with a 'BOP After Action team' investigating Epstein's suicide.
The employee mentioned a 'white man with a Southern accent' involved in the shredding, who was unfamiliar to MCC staff.
The employee contacted the FBI on August 23, 2019, to report the incident.
Third-hand information suggested an officer advised the former MCC warden that Epstein should have been housed in the 10 South wing.
